New-York Historical Society
Time Inc. Administration, Human Resources and Personnel Records
Time, inc.
MS 3009-RG 17
31 Linear feet in 31 record cartons
1939-1994 (bulk 1968-1985) The Time Inc. Administration, Human Resources and Personnel Records document employee relations, benefits, participation in unions, and Time Inc.'s efforts to create or implement personnel policies and guidelines.
Arrangement Note
Organized into four series:
Series I. Administration: Director of Administration: Rosemarie Di Sapio Files
Series II. Human Resources and Personnel: General Office Files
Series III. Personnel: Vice President and Director: Robert M. Steed Files
Series IV. Human Resources: Vice President: John R. Bingle Files
Historical Note
In 1949, the Personnel Department existed independently within Time Inc. with Edward Rhett as its director. Within the department are staff position for Employee Records and Benefits, Interviewing, Orientation, and Medical.
By 1960, Personnel added staff to oversee the central files. Outside of the Personnel Department, Time Inc. created a position for Corporate Staff Relations. Louis Gratz occupied this position in the 1960 department head list in the Time Inc. Reference Files.
By 1970, the department head list has the Personnel Office under Corporate overseen by Vice President of Administration and International Charles Bear. The Medical Office has separated from Personnel, but is an administrative unit overseen by Bear. Within Personnel, Charles Gleason, Jr. is the Vice President and Personnel Director, and William Trent is the Assistant Director. Other staff position remain the same as in the 1960 directory.
By 1980, the department head list has the Personnel Office under Corporate Administration with Robert Steed as Director and Deane Raley as Associate Director. The Medical Director is part of Personnel again. Personnel has added Affirmative Action Officers, a Director of Staff Development, and Employment Counselors.
The 1986 Management Directory lists Human Resources (HR) and Administration as separate departments under the Corporate Group, both overseen by the Chief Administrative Officer. HR has Directors of Affirmative Action, Benefits, Compensation, and a Medical Department. Rosemarie Di Sapio is Director of Administration, and Administration includes a Manager of Personnel.
A memorandum in Assistant Corporate Editor David Maness's files states that John Bingle is Steed's successor.
Citations:
Time Inc. Reference Files, MS 3009-RG 3, New-York Historical Society.
Time Inc. Corporate Editorial Records, MS 3009-RG 6, New-York Historical Society.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers with the exception of Series I, Series III.E, and other restricted materials. Restricted materials include privileged attorney correspondence; student records; medical records; personnel performance or evaluations; contracts and agreements; and records with personally identifiable information. Restricted materials are located in boxes 645 to 647 and R6 to R8. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Use Restrictions
This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.
Preferred Citation Note
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Administration, Human Resources and Personnel Records, MS 3009-RG 17, New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information Note
The Time Inc. Administration, Human Resources and Personnel Records were processed by Holly Deakyne in November 2016. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Deakyne created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produced this finding aid.
Related Archival Materials Note
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. records and are currently unprocessed. Additional personnel policies and records may be in the Reference files (MS 3009.RG 3).
Scope and Contents Note
The Time Inc. Administration, Human Resources and Personnel Records span from 1939 to the 1990s and include files from Rosemarie Di Sapio, Director of Administration; Robert Steed, Vice President, Personnel Director; and John Bingle, Vice President, Human Resources. Many of the files from 1939 through the 1950s look like they were retained or collected for reference reasons.
Topics include Time Inc. budgets and budgets for the Human Resources and Personnel departments; Time Inc. strategic plans; union negotiations and contracts; transitioning employees during business mergers and takeovers such as with the Washington Star; agenda and materials from the Compensation Policy Committee and Administrative Committee; compensation plans; employee stock ownership plans; healthcare management proposals; implementation of databases or other systems; insurance summaries; pension plans; memoranda discussing implementation or changes of benefits and bonuses; summer internships; Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) changes; marketing materials from outside sources; Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) forms; and employee handbooks.
While HR and Personnel are not the offices of record for some materials (budgets, strategic plans), these materials are retained here in the event they are the only record.
Because of the limited date range for these records, it is possible earlier records related to personnel matters were interfiled into RG 1: Subject Files, RG 2: Bio Files or RG 3: Reference Files. The majority of Human Resources and Personnel records created after the mid-1980s may have been handled using the retention policies established at that time and never archived.
Appraisal Note
Due to the permanent restrictions on the materials, one box of records from the Medical Department has been removed and returned to Time Inc.
Provenance
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.

It looks like statistics that Human Resources collected in the event they needed to report to the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC).Budget: Time Inc.: 1974-1982172342626Employee Benefits Handbooks: 1984, 1988-19891805086271-3Securities and Exchange Commission1729866274-5Strategic Plan: 1981-19851729856276Series III: Personnel: Vice President and Director: Robert M. Steed Files17239424 Linear feetin 24 record cartons1939-1985 (bulk 1968-1985)
Arrangement Note
Organized into seven subseries:
Subseries III.A. General Office Files Subseries III.B. Benefits Subseries III.C. Human Resources Staff Subseries III.D. International Subseries III.E. Situations Subseries III.F. Subsidiaries Subseries III.G. Union Relations
Scope and Contents Note
The groups of files in this series were found housed together and the primary correspondent is Robert "Bob" M. Steed, Vice President, Personnel Director. The largest run of alphabetically grouped files are designated as general office files while smaller groupings address specific topics or areas of the company. His files document changes in Time Inc. benefits, compensation, employment policies and guidelines; directories and staff lists; and personnel statistics.Subseries III.A: General Office Files17239511.8 Linear feetin 12 record cartons1945-1984 (bulk 1968-1984)
Arrangement Note
Organized alphabetically.
Scope and Contents Note
The General Office Files include a range of topics handled by Human Resources and Personnel including changes in employment law; medical and life insurance; leave policies; other benefits such as Union Relations1729414.1 Linear feetin 6 record cartons1939-1983
Scope and Contents Note
Union Relations contains the Personnel office's research and work on job classifications, and Time Inc.'s interactions and negotiations with the Newspaper Guild of New York. Besides Steed's records, there are records from Louis Gratz in the Labor Relations office, which was not part of Personnel. These records are comingled with Steed's records, and Steed might have inherited them. The records include meeting minutes and a salary study from the Continuing Classification Committee, copies of union contracts from other news organizations along with other research dating back to 1939, Time Inc. job descriptions, and Time Inc.'s union contracts.
Arrangement Note

Negotiations and Contracts: 1966-1972, 1983 [RESTRICTED]189263R735-36Series IV: Human Resources: Vice President: John R. Bingle Files1723412.1 Linear feetin 3 record cartons1974-1985
Arrangement Note
The arrangement of this series is based on the original arrangement of office files grouped chronologically by year.
Scope and Contents Note
These files were found housed together and the primary correspondent is John "Jay" R. Bingle, VP of Human Resources. His files include correspondence, memoranda, and reports regarding Time Inc. benefits, compensation, and policies.1977: Personnel and Compensation Committee17234562811983: Group insurance17234662821983-1984: Benefit plan amendments1723476283-41983-1985: Pisces Project Team18704662851984: Alfred P.
